item.title: Google "We have no moat, & neither does OpenAI"
item.description: - A leaked internal Google document claims that open source AI is doing better than Google and OpenAI in terms of speed, customization, privacy protection, and capability.

item.title: Scaling up the Prime Video audio/video monitoring service & reducing costs
item.description: - Prime Video's tool for monitoring every stream viewed by customers helps identify perceptual quality issues and triggers a process to fix them.

item.title: So this guy is now S3. All of S3
item.description: - This website is best experienced by visiting the website directly.

item.title: Facebook has not been doing enough to comply with a 2020 privacy order: FTC
item.description: - The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) alleges that Facebook has failed to comply with a 2020 privacy order and has caused new harm, including misrepresenting Messenger Kids' access to private youth data.

item.title: The money spent on lotteries doesn't go to the park
item.description: - Recreation.gov charges fees for managing lotteries for access to national parks and destinations, such as The Wave, Angels Landing, Half Dome, and more.

item.title: EARN IT Act undermines the privacy, security, & safety of law-abiding users
item.description: - The EARN IT Act undermines the privacy, security, and safety of law-abiding users while making child sexual abuse crime prosecutions more difficult.

item.title: The seven programming ur-languages (2021)
item.description: - The article introduces seven "ur-languages" in programming that serve as the basis for different programming paradigms: ALGOL, Lisp, ML, Self, Forth, APL, and Prolog.

item.title: Mojo might be the biggest thing to happen in programming for decades
item.description: - Mojo is a programming language based on Python that offers improved performance and deployment options.

item.title: Shopify will be smaller by about 20% & Flexport will buy Shopify Logistics
item.description: - Shopify is undergoing significant changes to refocus on its main quest of making commerce simpler, easier, more democratized, more participatory, and more common.

item.title: Googlers angry about CEO's $226M pay after cuts in perks & 12,000 layoffs
item.description: - Google employees express anger over CEO Sundar Pichai's $226 million compensation package following layoffs and cost-cutting measures.
